General  
1. POC holders apply for admission in NUST and are being dealt on case to case basis. 
POC program endeavours to provide eligible foreigners with unprecedented incentives to get 
back to their roots. There is a requirement of formulating a policy whereby the POC holders 
are facilitated to get admission in NUST.    
Salient Aspects  
2. An IHD to discuss admission criteria for POC holders and foreigners was held on 28 
Oct 2021 under chairmanship of Pro-Rector (A), minutes attached as Anx-A. It is pertinent to 
mention that majority of the public sector universities are charging the national fee from POC 
holder students and consider them in foreigner category.

3. During  the  meeting,  it  was  proposed  that POC  holders may  be allowed  to  appear  in 
NET.  If selected they will be charged the fee being paid by national students. The same has 
been approved by the Rector on 2 Jan 2022, minute sheet, duly approved.  
4. The decision regarding POC holders has been implemented with effect from NET-2022 
(Series-2).  
5. There  was  a  proposal  of  giving  the  foreign  applicants  a chance  to  apply  for UG 
admission on the basis of NET, in addition to ACT / SAT. This will facilitate the foreigners 
residing  in  Pakistan  as  well  as  those  from  abroad who  can  appear  in  the  NET  conducted  in 
Pakistan and get selected on open merit. However, they will be required to pay the tuition fee 
and allied charges in USD, as admissible for the international students. May be considered for 
implementation starting from admission cycle 2023. 
Benefits to NUST 
6. The  decision  will result  into  increase  in  the  number  of  students  in  international 
category, thereby having a positive impact on the overall ranking of NUST by various national 
and international age-0o-oncies.
